intro: Pimelea intermedia, commonly known as the common bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical inflorescences that resemble bottle brushes. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and features narrow, needle-like leaves. It produces small, brightly colored flowers, usually in shades of red, pink, or white, which attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. Pimelea intermedia is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
